conversation.content: 好，我现在说几个词，你重复一遍。准备好了吗？
[confused] 等等，我现在是不是应该已经戴上耳机了？因为我现在听你说话清清楚楚的，这样测听力还有什么意义啊。
对，把耳机戴上。开始了啊。棒球。
[quickly] 帮球。诶不对不对，肯定不是这个。棒球？不过说真的，帮球听着更有意思——大家互相帮助传球什么的。
对了。下一个词：飞机。
[slurring] 灰鸡。这倒是能解释为什么我的航班老是延误了——可能在给鸡洗澡呢。灰鸡算接近吗？
是飞机。继续啊。冰淇淋。
冰淇淋！终于有个不像我在瞎编词儿的了。虽然我刚才差点听成"病期林"，那画面感还挺诗意的。
不错。现在：生日。
星期。我生日正好是星期四，所以虽然听错了但精神上算对，行不行？
差不多。是生日。下一个：人行道。
人形岛。这听着又诡异又有趣。像那种…怎么说呢…网红打卡地会搞的噱头，什么神秘岛屿造型像个人。
[playful] 你其实比大部分人表现好多了。热狗。
热狗！看吧，食物相关的词我特别准。我的耳朵很有觉悟——自动过滤掉其他的，只捕捉能吃的东西。
很好。牛仔。
流仔。像是专门管理河流的牛仔。说真的这个点子能赚钱——景观水系管理专家什么的。
挺有创意的。牙刷。
芽花。反正我早上的流程也差不多是这个意思。谁需要刷牙啊，直接嚼薄荷叶不就完了。
差一点儿。最后一个：游乐场。
油老厂！不过想想也差不多，都是小孩子跑来跑去，偶尔还有人吐，基本上是一回事儿。

original_conversation.content: Okay, I'm going to say some words and you repeat them back. Ready?
[confused] Wait, am I supposed to have these headphones on already? Because right now I can hear you perfectly fine, which seems to defeat the whole purpose of testing if I'm going deaf.
Yes, put the headphones on. Let's start. Baseball.
[quickly] Faceball. No wait, that can't be right. Baseball? Though honestly faceball sounds way more entertaining as a sport.
Correct. Next word: airplane.
[slurring] Hairplane. Actually that would explain why my flights are always delayed—they're probably untangling the propellers. Is hairplane even close?
It was airplane. Let's continue. Ice cream.
Ice cream! Finally one that doesn't sound like I'm making up Dr. Seuss words. Though I did briefly consider "mice dream" which would be adorable.
Good. Now: birthday.
Thursday. Which is coincidentally when my actual birthday is, so I'm counting that as spiritually correct even if audiologically wrong.
Close. It was birthday. Next: sidewalk.
Cider block. That sounds dangerous and delicious at the same time. Like something they'd serve at a hipster bar that also does construction.
[playful] You're actually doing better than most people. Hotdog.
Hotdog! See, I excel at food-related words. My ears have their priorities straight—they filter out everything except potential meals.
Excellent. Cowboy.
Koiboy. Like a cowboy but for fish farming. Honestly that's a million dollar business idea right there—decorative pond wranglers.
That was creative. Toothbrush.
Juice rush. Which is what I call my morning routine anyway. Who needs dental hygiene when you can just gargle orange juice?
Almost. Last one: playground.
Greyhound! Though I suppose both involve children running in circles and occasionally someone throws up, so they're basically the same thing.
